titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Ken Knabb Papers
titlestmt.author: by Beinecke staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Wednesday May 1, 2019 at 03:06

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, writings, printed material, photographs, audio visual material, electronic files, and other papers by or relating to Ken Knabb.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.
Boxes 13: Restricted fragile material. For further information consult the appropriate curator.
Boxes 43-47 (audiovisual materials): Restricted fragile material. Reference copies may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.
Boxes 48-49 (digital media): Use of originals is restricted. Reference copies may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into seven series: I. Correspondence, circa 1970s-2010s. II. Writings and publications, circa 1970s-2003. III. Subject files, 1939-2005. IV. Printed material, circa 1960s-2006. V. Posters, circa 1970s. VI. Audiovisual material, 1956-1996. VII. Electronic media, circa 1977-2000s.

bioghist.head: Ken Knabb
bioghist.p: Ken Knabb is an American writer, translator, and radical theorist known for his translations of Guy Debord and the Situationist International.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Purchased from Ken Knabb and Didier Lecointre-Dominique Drouet on the Edwin J. Beinecke Book Fund, 2016.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Ken Knabb Papers. General Collection, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collections are processed to a variety of levels, depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived research value, the availability of staff, competing priorities, and whether or not further accruals are expected. The library attempts to provide a basic level of preservation and access for all collections as they are acquired, and does more extensive processing of higher priority collections as time and resources permit.
This collection received a basic level of processing, including rehousing and minimal organization.

Information included in the Description of Papers note and Collection Contents section is drawn from information supplied with the collection and from an initial survey of the contents. Folder titles appearing in the contents list below are often based on those provided by the creator or previous custodian. Titles have not been verified against the contents of the folders in all cases. Otherwise, folder titles are supplied by staff during initial processing.
This finding aid may be updated periodically to account for new acquisitions to the collection and/or revisions in arrangement and description.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Ken Knabb Papers is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

did.unittitle: Correspondence with foreign groups and individuals

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains correspondence with: Isaac Cronin, Dan Hammer, Gina Rosenberg, Chris Shutes, Jeanne Smith, Tita Carrion, Robert Cooperstein, notice groups, Jim Brook, Linda Wiens (Annihiland), Jerry Beers, John Lepper, Unru Lee, Twilight In Turkey (Chicago journal), Lorraine Perlman / Black & Red, Nick Brandt / Spontaneous Combustion, John McHale, and Tommy Haruki. Also contains correspondence from: Canada, Latin America, Africa, Hong Kong, Japan, Indonesia, New Zealand, Australia, miscellaneous non-European countries, and England.

did.unittitle: Correspondence with foreign groups and individuals

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains correspondence from: Greece, Spain / Portugal, Italy, Germany, Scandinavia, Poland and Eastern Europe, miscellaneous Euroean countries (including Switzerland, Belgium, Netherlands, Austria), and France. Also includes correspondence with: Jean-Francois Labrugere, Christian Camous, Daniel and Francoise Denevert, Joel Cornuault and Nadine Bloch, Center for Research on Social Question - CRQS (regarding split), Andre Trillaud, Jean Pérès, Roger Gregoire and Linda Lanphear, Jean-Pierre Voyer, and Gérard Lambert.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains material relating to: Situationist International Anthology, specifically letters requesting permission to reproduce articles, reviews and responses, leftover notes and unused articles, publicity materials, and letters to various publishers regarding attempts to unsuccessfully publish the anthology; Village Voice articles regarding Situationist International, and people influenced by Situationist International; notes, articles and leaflets regarding Guy Debord films, film translations and Alice Debord's Les Princes du Jargon; comments on Bureau of Public Secrets (BPS). Also contains: miscellaneous correspondence, including letters from over 100 United States prisoners.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains: early drafts and notes from "Confessions of a Mild-Mannered Enemy of the State" and "The Joy of Revolution," sources for "The Joy of Revolution," draft designs for the cover of "Public Secrets," reprint and translations of various Ken Knabb publications, notes on diverse topics (including Gary Snyder, religion, the Gulf War, books, radical film, etc.), documents and letters regarding the 1977 break-up of the Notice group, and various other manuscript material.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains: Notes regarding the 1977 breakup of the Notice group, Notes regarding Ken Knabb's Japan and Hong Kong trip (Fall 1977), including notes and drafts for "A Radical Group in Hong Kong," notes regarding Ken Knabb and Isaac Cronin's 1982 New Orleans trip, and personal notes regarding dreams.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains: material by Council for the Eruption of the Marvelous (1970); minor leaflets related to the Bureau of Public Secrets (1973-), as well as price lists, publicity materials, order forms, and annoucements of new publications; early texts by Ken Knabb and Ron Rothbart, including "1044" items (circa 1970); notes and drafts regarding Contradiction, an unrealized journal regarding critiques of the New Left movement (circa 1970-1972), including "Movement Critique," "Poverty of Hip Life," "Contradiction Journal" and "Contradiction Texts"; leaflets and pamphlets regarding Point-Blank (after Contradiction); various Bureau of Public Secrets material (1973-). Also contains publications and correspondence from other American Situationist groups.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains publications and correspondence from American Situationist groups and people, including: Processed World, Columbia Anarchist League (C.A.L.) Press, Against Sleep and Nightmare (A.S.A.N.), John Zerzan, The Last International / Bob Black, Not Bored!, Len Bracken, Fifth Estate, and For Ourselves.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains drafts and proofs of: The Complete Poems of Kenneth Rexroth (circa 2002); Public Secrets: Collected Skirmishes of Ken Knabb; In the Crossfire: Adventures of a Vietnamese Revolutionary; Guy Debord: Complete Cinematic Works (circa 2003); Centre de Recherche sur la Question Sociale / Bureau of Public Secrets (circa 1974).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains drafts and proofs of: Guy Debord: Complete Cinematic Works.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains galley proofs on index cards. Also contains a typescript draft, an Altaquito pamphlet, and a Chicago Review postcard and subscription envelope.

did.unittitle: Situationist International Anthology, Dave Blake's tapes for "Suppress Religion pamphlet"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains chadless microcomputer tape.

did.unittitle: Situationist International Anthology, drafts and proofs

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains reproductions of proofs.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Restricted fragile material. Reference copies may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Materials are on thermal fax paper, which have been fused together.

did.unittitle: Situationist International Anthology, offset master negatives

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains offset master negatives, used in the printing process of Situationist International Anthology.

did.unittitle: Situationist International Anthology, offset master negatives

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains offset master negatives, used in the printing process of Situationist International Anthology. Also contains a photocopy of the proof for Public Secrets.

did.unittitle: Situationist International Anthology, layouts and proofs

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains: Bureau of Public Secrets buisness card; Bureau of Public Secrets "Evading the Transformation of Reality" and "The War and the Spectacle" print sheets; Situationist International Anthology layout proofs; Situationist International Anthology book cover proofs.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains notes, drafts and correspondence regarding Ken Knabb's publications and translations. Includes Double-Reflection material, Society of Situationism (S.O.S.) material, and Situationist International Anthology material.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains photocopies of the lyrics of French songs.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains files related to: the Gulf War (1990-1991); Engaged Buddhism; "We Don't Want Full Employment (Workless Movement)", Dorothe (Bendon) van Ghent's master thesis on Gertrude Stein, Laura Riding and Kenneth Rexroth (1935); "Kenneth Rexroth: At Large in San Francisco" drafts; "Bureau of Public Secrets" website print-outs, statistics and indexes; recent typed notes; Potlatch, number 1, photocopy (22 June 1954); "The Society of the Spectable," by Guy Debord, uncorrected proof (1990); The Situationist International: The Real Split; Secret Publics: Escarmouches complètes de Ken Knabb, 1970-1997 (1997).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains files related to: Débat d'Orientation de l'Ex-Internationale Situationniste; Recordando a Los Clásicos.

did.unittitle: Rexroth, Kenneth - Camping in the Western Mountains

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains photocopies of the unpublished manual, reproduced from the State University of New York at Buffalo.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains material regarding Gary Snyder, various printed material specifically regarding Kenneth Rexroth, Kenneth Rexroth's correspondence, Morgan Gibson's "Revolutionary Rexroth," various correspondence regarding Kenneth Rexroth's writings, photocopies of interviews, and various material involving Ken Knabb's book "The Relevance of Rexroth," as well as it's translation into French and Spanish.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains various material regarding Kenneth Rexroth, including writings by others on Rexroth, reviews of Kenneth Rexroth, and interviews. Also contains a draft of Ken Knabb's "The Relevance of Rexroth."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains a t-shirt, produced in Japan, for an international festival celebrating Kenneth Rexroth, and the 100th year of his birth. The t-shirt is orange, has an image of Rexroth. The shirt is dated 22 August 2005.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains various photostatic copies of Kenneth Rexroth articles and material.

did.unittitle: Printed material from the collection of Richard Kempton

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains books with marginalia, from Richard Kempton's collection. Also contains various bookmarks removed from printed materials.

did.unittitle: The Sixties: Clippings, with emphasis on Berkeley.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains a large three-ring binder with 1960s and post-Sixties articles and flyers, from the collection of Richard Kempton.

did.unittitle: "Heel dit Raderwerk Staat Stil... Als Uw Macht'ge Arm Dat Wil," poster

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains Dutch poster, from the collection of Richard Kempton.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains various material from the collection of Richard Kempton: The International Times newspaper (1966 November-1968 September); Earth magazine (1971 September); Ramparts magazine (1973 February); a photocopy of "When The New Left Was New," by Stanley Aronowitz; "Making History vs. Making Life: Dilemmas of an American Left," typescript, by Dick Flacks. Also includes a dealer list of Richard Kempton material found within the collection.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains incomplete issues from the collection of Richard Kempton.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains incomplete issues from the collection of Richard Kempton.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains various incomplete newspapers from the collection of Richard Kempton, concentrating on 1960s and 1970s counter-culture. Includes: San Francisco's Dock of the Bay newspaper (1972); City Miner peridocial (1979); Express newspaper (1989); Counter Catalogue (Spring 1973); The Daily Gater, San Francisco State College newspaper (1967); NYT Super Love newspaper, Dutch (1968); The Organ newspaper (circa 1970s); The Daily Californian, University of California, Berkeley, newspaper (1960-1984); S-B gazette (1968); San Francisco Oracle newspaper (circa 1967); Good Times newspaper (1969); Berkeley Tribe newspaper (circa 1969).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains various clippings and incomplete newspapers from the collection of Richard Kempton, concentrating on 1960s and 1970s counter-culture. Includes: The San Francisco Chronicle newspaper (1960-1970); Rolling Stone magazine (1968-1973). Also includes The Great Poster Trip: Art Eureka catalog (1968).

did.unittitle: Situationist International and post-Situationist texts, translations and correspondence

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains material from French, American and Italian Situationist publications and groups. Includes photocopied correspondence, and material relating to: Veritable Scission, Guy Debord, René Viénet, and Nadine Bloch and Joël Cornuault. Also includes: Viénet, France May 1968: Enragés and Situationists in the Occupations Movement; copies and documents from the Strasbourg scandal; Early English translations of several dozen miscellaneous Situationist International articles; Centre de Recherche sur la Question Sociale (CRQS) material.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains material from French, American and Italian Situationist publications and groups. Includes material relating to: Luc Mercier, Encyclopédie des Nuisances, Mordicus, Alliance pour l'opposition à toutes les nuisances, Interrogations pour la Communaute Humaine, L'Insecurite Sociale, J.F. Lahaeye, Laurent Chaumette, Le Frondeur, Gérard Lambert, Champ Libre, various French publishers, Jean-Pierre Voyer, Internationale Nexialiste, Jimmy Lallement and Joël Guigne, and Le G.R.C.A.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains international anarchist and leftist leaflets, pamphlets, and articles, especially from: the United States, Latin America (e.g. Mexico, Brazil and Argentina), Spain, Canada, Australia, New Zealand, Greece, Germany and Japan. Also includes clippings, Occupy movement material, American Surrealism material, Spontaneous Combustion, Agentur fur die Selbstaughebung des Proletariats, material regarding a book on Ngo Van, and Secrets Publics.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Also includes photocopies of "Suggestions Relatives au Legitime Eloge de l'I.S.," by Daniel Denevert, "Big Town, Little Town," by Kenneth Rexroth, and "A Bibliography of North American Situationists Texts."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains two Kenneth Rexroth catalogs, as well as various British tracts.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains three art catalogs regarding Danish painter, sculptor, ceramic artist, and author Asger Jorn.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains: Bureaucratic Comix mechanical; Situationist International Anthology mechanical, poster and broadsides; Public Secrets cartoons; a heavily damaged San Francisco concert poster (7 October 1966), featuring The Paul Butterfield Blues Band, Jefferson Airplane and the Grateful Dead.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains three posters with comic art. Two are French, one is Dutch.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Restricted Fragile Material. Reference copies of audiovisual material may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains: audio recordings of Lettrist Poetry (from Jean-Isidore Isou's film "Traite du bave de d'eternite"); a radio program about the situationists on "France Culture" (May 1996); Jim Burill: The Driver Who Stole Cargo; End of Prehistory (a program created by Bay Area situationist groups and broadcast on Pacifica Radio KPFA); Ken Knabb's recording of "Madrid meeting" (circa 2001); Ken Knabb's recording of "Hong Kong meeting" (circa 1977); Kenneth Rexroth's autobiography; French Songs vol. I and II; Janice Leber's "That Was the War That Was;" Jean-Pierre Voyer: Introduction a la science de la publicite; Claude Meunier: Une societe peut en cacher aun autre!; Situationist International Anthology from the Royal National Institute for the Blind; Kenneth Rexroth / Lawrence Ferlinghetti With The Cellar Jazz Quintet ‎– Poetry Readings In The Cellar (1957); Kenneth Rexroth ‎– Poetry And Jazz At The Blackhawk (circa 1956); Pour en finir avec le travail Chansons du prolétariat révolutionnaire - Vol : 1 (1974); None Shall Escape, Caribbean Situationist versus Trevor Menroe (circa 1983). Also contains videocassette recordings of: Guy Debord, son art et son temps; Guy Debord's The Society of the Spectacle; La Société du spectacle and Réfutation de tous les jugements; Refutation of All Judgements; René Viénet's Can Dialectics Break Bricks?; Les Filles de Kamare; Gil Wolman's L'Anticoncept; Isaac Cronin's Call It Sleep.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Restricted Fragile Material. Reference copies of electronic files may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains electronic media labeled: Knabb on Radio Literature; Ken Knabb speaks at City Lights Book, 25 January 2011; Situs and Occupy, Marxist Library, 5 February 2012; Celebrating Kenneth Rexroth collected poetry, San Fransico Public Library, 8 February 2003; Ken Knabb Addresses the S.F. Anarchist Book Fair, 9 April 2011; Can Dialectics Break Bricks? S.I., 1973; In Girum Imus Nocte Et Consumimur Igni, by Guy Debord; Society of the Spectacle, by Guy Debord, 2008; In Girum, 2011.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains 1/2 inch (12.7 mm) wide magnetic tape within a protective case. Also includes a data sample, printed on continuous stationery, and taped to the protective case.
